engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Maintaining a stable orbit at a safe distance from a central body, in this case the sun, to ensure the longevity and stability of the system.
Organizing the system in a flat, disk-like structure to minimize gravitational interactions and maintain stability.
Positioning the system at a distance from the central body to regulate temperature and prevent melting or sublimation of icy bodies.
Utilizing gravitational interactions with nearby objects to perturb the orbits of icy bodies and send them on trajectories towards the inner solar system.
